leads.business_name: Gateway Medical Pharmacy | Long Term Care and Compounding Pharmacy
leads.worst_review_text:
Don't know what happened here but big red flags.
I've used this pharmacy exclusively for years. Had my dr send in my regular prescription today and got a call in the afternoon full on berating me for sending them in. "We ALREADY TOLD YOU we don't fill this medication!"
I told the tech that conversation never happened. No one talked to me about it and I've been getting it filled there for years with no issues.
I call back and ask for someone higher to speak to because WOW I've never been treated this way there. They're normally very nice and polite. Owner gets on the phone and claims I haven't had a prescription there in a year minus one pick up recently.
How? I get refills every month and always from them. They defended the way the tech spoke to me even though the "notes saying we already told you this" weren't there either.
So, how are they tracking things if none of my refills were documented? Why are they calling regulars to reem them out about "notes on the account" that don't exist?
This used to be such a reliable pharmacy. Recommended it to everyone. Not anymore.

leads.address: 5253 SE 82nd Ave UNIT 27, Portland, OR 97266, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Everyone is nice there but honestly very frustrating to work with. They always say the pharmacist is going to call me with an update if I inquire about a prescription, yet no one ever calls me. I will call in asking if my prescription will be ready and they state that it'll be ready by today. I go in and it's still not ready. My main thing is if you say you are going to do something, then freaking do it and not be surprised when I'm upset that show up to pick up my prescription the NEXT DAY and it's still not ready. This has happened on multiple occasions already! They're never good on their word and you have to check back with them multiple times just to get a damn prescription filled.

Capsule is going downhill fast. At first they had great delivery service. However, the last 3 times they have been over an hour late, arriving after 10:00pm at night. The medicine is delivered to a care facility for my elderly mother. Tonight was the breaking point. Capsule texts me at 10:30pm (1.5 hours late) after the last delivery window, stating nobody is answering the door. NO KIDDING!! The care facility and the patients are all sleeping!!!!! That was Friday night. Now my mother is without medication until Monday. This is unacceptable!! 10:30 PM???  Really???

leads.business_name: OHSU Physicians Pavilion Pharmacy, Marquam Hill
leads.address: OHSU Physicians Pavilion, 3270 SW Pavilion Loop Suite 110, Portland, OR 97239, USA

leads.worst_review_text: Pharmacy came to our assisted living facility. They were at least 25 minutes late and not organized. I finally decided they weren't worth the time. Unless they can correct their tardiness and being un organized, I  wouldn't recommend this Pharmacy.

leads.address: 2829 N Lombard St, Portland, OR 97217, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Note: It is entirely possible that this place could actually impact your real physical health in a negative way, and they would not even give a remote shred of a hint of a whiff of a damn. Cool stuff!

UPDATE: 45 days later. Never heard back. Not even an automated text. Shortly after my original review, I went back in person (again) and asked about the status, as well as whether their phone system works. The tech laughed (laughed!) and said, yeah, but sometimes we just get busy and leave it off the hook until things calm down because otherwise it'd just keep ringing. He told me this! Laughing! I'm starting to come around to thinking this place is a brilliant performance art installation. (I moved my prescription and got it filled elsewhere.) Read on if you're truly bored--perhaps on hold--and looking for something to do. Tldr: *Obi Wan voice* these are not the drugs you're looking for.

11/15/25: I just figured the reviews were overwhelmingly negative because most reviews of places like this tend to be negative. It's not like you're going there because things are awesome and them crushing it is usually just them handing you a bottle of pills, you know? My old pharmacy where I used to live had like a 2.3 and I never had issues there in like seven years there.

Nope! Wrong. I'm fascinated to talk to anyone who rated this any more than a 1.

It's just a mess. I've been on hold with them for going on 1:30:00 in the past two days [edit: nope it was 2+ hrs before I gave up tee hee], and it tells you when the number of callers ticks down, so you know that people are being talked to at an appallingly slow rate. Like, if you never heard the count go down, you could think, oh something's wrong with their system. But no, it appears that they've taken roughly 25 minutes to deal with each call in their queue. To me, that's a memorably long call. To them, that's just...average!

The place feels like where hope goes to die. It's so grim and desolate in there and the people working there shuffle around in s daze as if shellshocked. Like it's huge "my house burned down around me while I was sleeping so now I'm wearing one slipper and a singed bathrobe holding the door key I saw glinting in a pile of ash and staring into the middle distance" energy.

When I went ELEVEN days ago, they told me they were in the process of filing my prescription RIGHT THEN. (Imagine! It brings me a sort of rueful curdled joy to think of that. To think what could have been.) Just sit there and wait a couple mins, and we'll get it to you, they mumbled listlessly.

The rest of the story is boring (not as bored as I am right now, and it'd be cathartic, but I don't think boredom is one of those things you're supposed to pay forward). Rest assured, not only did I not get the Rx filled that night, I did not the following Tuesday, nor Wednesday, nor Thursday, nor, it looks like, today.

If it wasn't putting the quality of my life at significant risk to do so (a hypothetical world, dear reader, I earnestly wish we both lived in), I would just keep the prescription there and document the many shades of gray that color their blithe disinterest in doing the literal atomic least thing to fulfill their responsibility toward me, the customer with a health issue that severely impacts their ability to live a full life. Unfortunately, I cannot, and writing this review for way too long did not eat enough time to actually get me to a human (even if a bored and contemptuous one), so I guess I give up.

Wish me a safe weekend, everyone. I'm going to need it, thanks specifically to the fine folks at the Walgreens pharmacy!

leads.address: 7206 NE Sandy Blvd, Portland, OR 97213, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
Messaged about whether or not my prescription could be delivered, pharmacy responded, "we can def mail out to you."  The response struck me as a bit informal/unprofessional so I decided to pick up the first order and see about setting up refills for delivery while I was there.  When I arrived they said my order was still being processed. Then they said my prescription had been mailed...
There was no verification that I wanted it delivered - I had only asked if it was possible - nor was there a verification of address, which led to it being mailed to an old address. They also charged the card they had on file from 3 years ago without verifying and without letting me know the price of my prescription.
They were nice about the whole thing and refilled my order so I was able to leave with my meds, which I appreciated. Took me until I got home for the frustration to really set in. Will not be going through them in the future.

leads.address: 2606 NE Broadway suite b, Portland, OR 97232, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Everyone is so rude. Been going for years , know me, yet persist in asking same dumb questions. Cant just go in and pick up. Always a hassle. The hefty girl being the worst..

leads.address: 3030 NE Weidler St, Portland, OR 97232, USA
leads.worst_review_text: I got to the Fred Meyer “pharmacy,” and my prescription isn’t ready even though it’s been A Month since it got called in. I ask why, ‘cause I called two days ago and their AI-automated answering system (they have no option to talk to a real human) said it would be ready YESTERDAY by 12:25 pm, and they pull out a sheet that says there’s been some sort of error with my insurance—but they won’t explain to me what it is. And they haven’t contacted me about it, so I had no way to find out except to go in person. I’ve previously gotten multiple prescriptions filled at this location with the same insurance number. The lady, who was VERY short with me (most likely as I’m a teenager and she’s a boomer) said she couldn’t help me. Wish they’d contacted me so I didn’t waste an hour of my life in this miserable place. I hate it here

leads.address: 3131 SE Milwaukie Ave, Portland, OR 97223, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Not sure what happened to this place (condolences), but the service has been very poor the last few times I’ve come in. There are at least 6 people working at any given time and I am always made to wait an extended amount of time. Even after making eye contact and smiling at a worker, I am still not greeted for more than 5 minutes. If I wanted to be treated like I’m invisible, I would go to Fred Meyer. I’ll be finding a closer neighborhood pharmacy that knows how to say “Hey there, I’ll be with you in just a moment.” Don’t get me started on my experience with their lapse in HIPPAA compliance… they do get an extra star though because the woman who finally did help me is and always been very professional and friendly. She gets 5 stars

I have spent the last 24 hours in fear of my life while staying at this hospital tomorrow?If I'm lucky enough to wake up, I will be transferred to OHSU(A REAL HOSPITAL)and hopefully I will get to speak to the ACLU about LEGACYS code of conduct and all of the things I have recorded and have had happen to me In the short time that I have stayed here. if you were wise, You would go to any other hospital in fact, I would rather go to a back alley abortion clinic to have my finger readjusted than to  Have my fingernails cut at good Sam's in Portland it is an embarrassment of a hospital. It is an embarrassment of an establishment and it is an embarrassing blemish on our great city, I look at it as a blemish, and I will forever look down upon the doctors and people.  Who work at this establishment? I hope my followers see this and I hope my followers understand and they follow if only to save a life because honestly, I don't think I'm gonna make it through the night and I don't think it'll be my health that kills me.  So that is my review. Thank you.

leads.address: 2100 NW Glisan St, Portland, OR 97210, USA
leads.worst_review_text:
The food is decent on a good night. I’ve patroned the bar 6X in as many years for a late night takeout. On average the food is a solid 3 stars. Which isn’t bad for late night bar food.  The staff is polite and gracious. While I haven’t sat inside, the vibe seems pretty good too.

Here’s my issue. In the last week I’ve ordered twice and tipped. “Tip the kitchen staff $5 X2”. I ordered onion rings on both orders. Even though I asked if ranch/dipping sauce was included,  I was told it was and it was not. My second order included 10 wings. I was told the order was complete, but there’s no ranch or sauce. This isn’t exactly a big deal.  However it is disappointing. Considering that this wasn’t a mishap. This is apparently the practice for take out. I tipped $10 on a takeout order. Just give me some darn dipping sauce for my wings and rings, especially considering that I requested to receive what is stated on the menu as “included”.

Lastly. If your tomato soup needs to be heavily watered because you’re out. It should be customary to ask your customers if they still want it. I don’t quite enjoy ordering food before working a 10 hour shift to not actually eat. I threw money and time away. I paid to receive a portion of food that I can’t consume.

In a good faith and support of local business, I won’t give 1 star. But tonight’s experience was exactly that. I’m grouchy from hunger and angry that my next 2 hours of work I’ll be working for money I threw away for inedible food.

leads.business_name: Holiday Inn Bern - Westside by IHG
leads.worst_review_text: personnel orgueilleux. Ils réclament de l'argent pour chaque souffle.  The lady in the reception on the 29th of November, at 11 am, asked for money for the parking. How in the world a 4 stars hotel asks for money for the parking? I stayed in a 3 stars hotel in Schonberg in Bern where the parking was free the week before! The problem is, in western society, the concept of hospitality is exotic to them. We welcome you when you have money, when you pay more... Adding to that the deteriorating state of the furniture in the room! the chairs are old and incredibly used! Adding also to that, a 4 stars hotel does not put a fridge in the room! Why? to pay more in their restaurant....

2 years ago, I was referred by my dentist to the prosthesis maker who works there and is the owner of the practice.
2 weeks ago, I wanted to make some pictures for a Google review. Since the receptionist told me that it was okay, as long she was not in the pictures, I made a few.
When another dentist came out of her room, she was asking what I was doing, and if that was necessary, in a not so nice way. That made me a bit tense, since, when does someone, who you don't know, ask you these questions in a hostile way?
Since then, I am not welcome anymore. I was told that I had to ask the owner upfront to take the pictures. Since on the reading table there is a QR code where they ask to make a Google review this seems a bit odd to me. When I was asked inside, they told me I was aggressive, I was not aggressive, I was tense, due to the incident that happened before with the other dentist. I still don't know what went wrong. The fact is, however, I am expelled.

I booked two rooms and had issues right from the start. The self check-in link didn’t work, and after wasting time on site, I only managed to check in for one room. For the other, I still had to go to the office to get a key card. The staff simply said “it doesn’t work for some rooms,” which makes the whole system pointless.

The quality of the two rooms was completely inconsistent. The “newly renovated” room was poorly done, cheap-looking, bad quality, and with a terrible view. (Photos attached so you can judge for yourself.)

What made everything worse was the attitude. There was no apology, and the staff was rude and dismissive, telling me no one had ever complained about the room before. Well, now you have.

Overall, a frustrating and unprofessional experience.

We came here to eat supper and ordered just nuggets and soup at 21:12, and at 21:50 we are still sitting and waiting.
After 40 minutes the bread was offered.
At 21.57 we received the order.
BTW ice tea is good, and the food is good.
I saw after I paid that the package was broken. when I asked if i could get a new one they only said 'weg hier' (get out of here). They were more busy that noting was stolen then answering politely.

#1 laundry is listed as dry cleaning/service AND Laundry Facilities and this is a BAIT and SWITCH. NO WASHER/DRYER onsite. They only have Laundry/Dry Cleaning service that has a pick up before noon...but check in is at 3pm. So, looks like dry cleaning is an upgrade and self-wash using a washer/dryer is provided as is, but that is the purest definition of a BAIT and SWITCH. Also, 2 flights of stairs no elevators. I booked solely on the purpose of using the Laundry being about a week in Switzerland, but left immediately upon finding out they dont. I even booked a stay in the city the same day with the promised amenities. But Max Avaiation  still Billed me even after they knew why I cancelled (also very difficult to get a hold of them). I'd recommend staying at STAY KOOOOK in Bern-Free laundry 24/7, FREE COFFEE, FREE Quality Tea, Massive Kitchen and GREAT location in the heart of the city with a private bathroom. Instead of Max Aviation with a shared Bathroom, Shared Kitchen, etc
the best customer service ever

Subject: Serious Concern Regarding Recent Dining Experience

Dear im Ackermannshof Team,

I’m writing to express my deep disappointment with a recent dinner at your restaurant, which sadly caused me significant physical discomfort and has shaken my trust in a place I once considered a favorite.

When I arrived, your waitress kindly assured me that my dietary requirements—lactose intolerant, vegetarian, and no alcohol—would be fully accommodated across the 4-course menu. I appreciated this, as I always communicate these clearly due to the severe discomfort I experience if they are not followed.

Unfortunately, the dishes served to me included buffalo mozzarella, fried feta cheese, and undercooked eggs, all of which I would not have expected based on my restrictions. I ate them, trusting that my needs had been taken into account, but not long afterward, I began experiencing severe bloating and pain, to the point I could barely sit still.

I spoke with the waitress during the meal, but was told the chef was too busy to address the issue. I ended up paying 400 CHF (with tip) for a dinner that made me sick.

This experience was not only disappointing but physically distressing. At the very least, I would have expected your team to take responsibility immediately and offer an appropriate response. I urge you to take dietary restrictions more seriously moving forward, and I would appreciate hearing how you plan to address this.

We stayed 2 nights here , the location is great , accessible to few tourist spots . But I feel this hotel is really NO safe. I found out my suitcase was opened, but luckily nothing was missing. Our hotel room door was not locked when we return in the midday after lunch . Room already cleaned. I also found the hotel cleaner put back the used coffee capsules back in the coffee rack. We never noticed until I found the used coffee capsules . I try to make coffee , unfortunately my cup only filled with plain water instead of coffee and this happened several times . See the picture for proof.

This was, without exaggeration, the worst luxury hotel I have stayed at in probably six years.

Hotel Les Trois Rois presents itself as a five-star grand dame, but the reality is a cold, disorganized, and frankly embarrassing operation that feels closer to a mediocre three-star property hiding behind history and branding.

The most egregious failure was on New Year’s Eve. The concierge personally made us a dinner reservation while I was standing directly in front of her. I tipped her extra for securing it, given the difficulty of NYE reservations in Basel. When we arrived at the restaurant, we were told we had no reservation. None. Completely nonexistent. There was no apology of substance, no accountability, and no attempt to meaningfully resolve the situation. Just blank stares and confusion.

The staff overall were detached, unhelpful, and consistently clueless. Not warm. Not anticipatory. Not professional. For a hotel that constantly signals its supposed prestige, the service culture is shockingly weak. There is an air of pretension without any of the competence to back it up.

They love to mention their Michelin credentials, but let’s be clear. This is not a three-key Michelin experience by any standard. I have stayed at many true Michelin-rated properties around the world. This is not one of them. The gap between what this hotel claims to be and what it actually delivers is vast.
It was also my birthday on New Year’s Day. My brother explicitly asked the hotel to arrange a birthday cake. The front desk assured him it would be taken care of. Of course, nothing was done. No cake. No acknowledgment. Nothing. At a supposed five-star hotel, failing at something this basic is inexcusable.

To make matters worse, when I asked to speak with a manager before departing, no manager ever came. No follow-up. No response. No apology. Silence. That indifference says everything about how this hotel actually treats its guests once payment is secured.

This place relies on its past reputation, its riverfront location, and its own self-importance. Strip that away and you are left with a poorly run hotel that mistakes arrogance for luxury and branding for service.

I will never return. If you value genuine hospitality, professionalism, and consistency, there are far better options in Switzerland and across Europe. Hotel Les Trois Rois is a masterclass in how to masquerade as elite while delivering mediocrity.

I had wrote the below comment 3 years ago and it was not posted by google:

“This is the worst dentists practice I ever had to deal with!
Waste of time and money!
First I get racist remarks that the manger tried to buy with wine and chocolate, then I get a treatment for 4 months that the manager does not believe in just because the ortho in house thinks it might work, then this uncertain elastics treatment is done wrongly anyway for those 4 months, then the first retainers do not match so I have to get the moulds done again, then due to a bad advice of the staff the second retainers break then they never call back to let me know what to do when hey say they would and after complaining to the manager again I get retainers for free... but not really because I cannot use what I got given that the retainer is stock on the mould and the other mould broken in shipment.
In the meantime we are over a month later and I still have no night retainers after having spent more than 3000€ at this practice!
This is a joke!”

Now my wire retains are broken and they do not want to replace them because I have left their horrible practice and gone back to my excellent original dentist. They said I should be back as patient with a dentist visit for them to help me!
Every other orthodontist I called to ask for help was shocked from their behaviour as it is normal practice for the orthodontist who placed the wire retainers to repair them!

Zero interest of patients in mind! All about money!

Unexperienced/uneducated hygienists.
I had a gum infection and went in for an emergency appointment the next day. I had to wait 35 minutes to see the dentist who explained I should get a cleaning.
I went in the next day and experienced a medieval (half!) cleaning by an apathetic hygenist. It was decided they could only do half of the cleaning that day.
A few minutes into the cleaning I asked for anesthesia because it was incredibly painful. A few minutes later I asked for more anesthesia because the pain was unbearable. As tears flooded from my eyes I asked the hygenist to stop yet again and either put more anesthesia or wait for it to sink in or find another solution. She didn't finish the cleaning, and said I should take antibiotics before we continued the cleaning. She was unable to say which antibiotics I should take and didn't remember for how long or how often I should take them.

She stood up and left the room without even offering me some water to rinse my mouth. I checked myself in the mirror and my mouth and face were full of blood and continued bleeding.
She came back with a dentist who explained the antibiotics and rescheduled another appointment in a week.
My face was numb for 6 hours.

I got an invoice for +200 EUR and after calling they explained this was the invoice for HALF of the cleaning + the emergency consultation.

Upon consultation with a second dentist it turns out they shouldn't even have started the cleaning with an infection because there was a risk of it spreading.

They sent a feedback survey and never even got back to me.

leads.business_name: Amsterdam Oral Surgery & Dental Implant Center
leads.address: 37 Prospect St 200 2nd floor, Amsterdam, NY 12010, USA
leads.worst_review_text: Strange place and atmosphere. There is a lot of tension in the office and with the dentists. I feel sorry for some of the staff. No one working there looks like they want to be there and I can understand why. Received a note from the dentist that I had been a no show, from a date 2 months before he wrote the letter. ???  Only that was not true. I spoke with his office manager (very nice) before the appointment and she canceled it for me. There was never a no show. There's more. It doesn't appear the 2 dentist - that are married - really "care" about their office and their patients.

leads.address: Jan van Galenstraat 171, 1056 BS Amsterdam, Netherlands
leads.worst_review_text:
I had to visit this practice while my regular dentist was away, and unfortunately, my experience with one of the dentists here, Dr. Yaser Almohamad, was very negative.

He told me I needed two fillings: one straightforward and one complicated, which he said might eventually require a root canal. That was fine with me, I just wanted the pain to stop. However, both appointments felt extremely rushed (about 15–25 minutes each). I'm not sure how anyone can properly complete a filling, especially a complicated one in that time. My regular dentist typically takes 35–45 minutes per filling.

Throughout both appointments, Dr. Almohamad barely communicated with me. He didn't fully explain what he was doing, didn't ask questions, and seemed detached and disinterested. When I tried to tell him about my symptoms, he didn't make eye contact or seem to listen.

Truthfully, none of these negative (but ultimately bearable) issues would have mattered if the fillings were done correctly. However, I feel that these oversights and lack of care actually led the dentist to do faulty fillings and to not provide good and honest dental care. Because after this 'complicated' second filling, when the anaesthesia wore off, I was left in severe pain, far worse than before treatment.

That night, I experienced unbearable, electric-shock-like pain shooting through my jaw and head. I've had many fillings over the years due to my bad teeth, but I've never left a dentist's office feeling worse than when I arrived.

I called the practice the next day and asked to see another dentist because I didn't want to return to Dr. Almohamad. Thankfully, another dentist (Dr. Kefallinou) saw me instead and she was much kinder, empathetic, and professional. She explained that the filling had been left too high and hadn’t been properly adjusted for my bite, which was causing the nerve pain. She smoothed it down, which helped for a short while.

Unfortunately, a few weeks later the pain returned - my face was feeling numb on the side of the fillings, I had incredible nerve pain and sensitivity beyond anything I've felt so far. When I finally saw my regular dentist, they found that the "complicated" filling had actually cracked the tooth, was too thick, and hadn't been sealed properly. I now have to have both fillings redone, but thankfully, no root canal is needed after all.

While the reception staff and other dentist at this practice were polite and helpful, my experience with Dr. Almohamad was genuinely awful. Both in terms of care and result. I would strongly recommend asking to see a different dentist if you attend this practice.

I discourage anyone from TPA for two reasons. First, the dentist Nils van Calcar is either incompetent or sloppy. During a yearly checkup he missed that I have a chipped front (!) tooth. When I noticed this and contacted him to get this fixed, I was told off for not saying anything about a chipped tooth. Hello? What is the purpose of a checkup if we should know already if there is something wrong? It’s the dentist's responsibility during checkup to see if there is something wrong. When I said this to the dentist, I’ve heard that "he sees thousands of patients with chipped teeth and he can’t notice them all" 🤣 that "he will no longer fix my tooth", and that I should "find myself a new place to go to". You do not want a sloppy and arrogant dentist who blames you for his mistakes instead of fixing them!

I was already weary of this dentist's bad reputation as my friend also had a bad experience. This dentist placed a very unfit filling and as a result my friend got a crack in this tooth. Your teeth pay the price for dentist's mess so choose a less sloppy dentist.

Second, TPA is a factory and the service terrible. They seem to schedule clients with 0 minutes in between. If you are 5 minutes late because of traffic, you are yelled at by the dentist (!) His time is precious, your time is not. Any functional practice schedules patients so that there is enough time for them when they happen to be a few minutes late.

In sum, Tandartsen Praktijk Amsterdam Jordan is a far cry from the personal attention and quality service they advertise on their website. I have not received any response to the issues I raised from the managers of the clinic either.

leads.address: Plantage Middenlaan 1 - souterrain, 1018 DA Amsterdam, Netherlands
leads.worst_review_text:
Boycott Lassustandartsen as a business at all costs. They have absolutely no regard or respect for their customers (not patients!)

Sharing my experience to save you from a bad one…

Lassus tandartsen begged me to give them one last try after they have consistently messed up billing and appointments that are booked 6 months in advance — the last one literally having caused me to lose the chance to speak to my father the day he passed away, because they kept me waiting (in keizersgracht location where there is no mobile reception). I complained, they responded after _weeks went by_, I gave them one last chance (why, You ask? Yeah me too) — and agreed to a checkup on a different location (at Plantage Middenlaan).

And then they call me _an hour before_ the appointment saying they _don’t have enough time today_ to see me properly, so they need to reschedule.

I have heard from others that this business can’t keep up with their customers. Let’s do them a favour and *boycott this business* until they fix the problems.

They literally don’t face any consequences for the kind of stress and disruption they cause. I intend to report this business to hold them accountable for their bad business practices.

Avoid this dentist at all costs for anything complicated like a root canal, a crown or worse an implant. Prices are cheaper than with most other dentists but the quality is really bad. I had a root canal and a crown, the dentist butchered me so much that when she had "finished" the nurse told her, "I'm happy you ended this because it was going so bad". And the dentist told me : "it should work for a few years". A few months later, the crown broke and I have not stopped having discomfort on this tooth.

Review – Dental365 Amsterdam (September 2023)

Unfortunately, I must share a very negative experience with Dental365 in Amsterdam, where both my husband and I were patients... I wait some time to make this decision to put my experience out. Was  really traumatic experience

In my case, there were repeated organizational failures – the assistant forgot to schedule my appointment twice. When I finally came in, I was not taken in for treatment but only for a consultation. The dentist informed me that my 12-year-old root canal treatment supposedly had a massive infection, even though I have no pain or any symptoms at all. I was told that I needed to act immediately and was referred to a specialized clinic in Amsterdam Oost.

After contacting this clinic by email, I was told that the treatment would cost approximately €2,200–3,000 and require 4–7 visits. This seemed excessive, so I sought a second opinion at Lassus Tandartsen and also at another clinic in Germany. Both clinics confirmed that what may appear as an infection on an X-ray can also be something else, and that it is not possible to make such a serious diagnosis based on an X-ray alone. The entire situation felt highly unprofessional and borderline fraudulent.

Despite my experience, my husband later went back to Dental365 for treatment. Unfortunately, due to a serious medical error, material was left inside his tooth, which led to a severe infection. As a result, he lost the tooth and suffered extreme pain, to the point where his condition became very serious.

When we started addressing the issue with Dental365 and a lawyer, the clinic later contacted us to inform us that we had been overcharged and that they needed to refund €150 due to their own mistake. This only further confirms the lack of professionalism.

At Lassus Tandartsen, we were assured that they would support us in court if necessary, as the loss of the tooth and the subsequent complications were clearly the dentist’s fault.

Honestly, if my husband had a heart condition, this situation could have been fatal.

Our experience with Dental365 has been shocking. My husband is from Amsterdam, and I have lived here for 14 years, so we know how healthcare normally functions in the Netherlands — and this was far below any acceptable standard.

I cannot recommend this clinic to anyone

I don’t know the name of the rude woman who picked up the phone yesterday (September 22, 2025) at 12:48pm from Lassusstraat 9 when I called about an inquiry to a surprise invoice of EUR 180, for a service that I did not schedule - basically got charged a paradontology clean up when I scheduled a regular one (and honestly cannot tell at all how different the cleaning I got was from the other regular cleaning visits where I paid EUR 25 !). She was rude, acted entitled, not customer focused, and just plainly disregarded me as a patient when I was trying to figure out why was I being charged so much. This episode took place after me having reached out on August 20, date in which I first received the invoice, and being told they’d investigate with the doctor and me not hearing a single thing for more than a month (which prompted me to call back yesterday).
Tremendous disappointment considering that my other interactions were good and the dentist work had been above average for the last 7 years that I’ve been a patient.

Two years later, this is the least emotional that I can manage for my review. I’ve had the worst dental experience of my life at this clinic the surgery that was performed on me to have my tooth extracted, which should’ve been a very simple procedure was incredibly painful when I left about six hours later, metal had worked its way out of my mouth, medical metal that had been left in my mouth by the surgeon. My dentist here at I’m still dental assured me that this was very unusual and she took the metal from me When I handed it to her. I was scheduled for a follow up appointment to check on the healing of my open wound socket in my mouth.
I arrive for my appointment to find out that it had been canceled and I had not been informed. Another appointment was not offered to me. I wrote this Clinic As with a complete lack of confidence in their abilities to even make keep an appointment. Fast-forward nearly 2 years later, and I’ve asked for my records to be forwarded to another dentist. Again, no response. I feel like all of the money that I paid for my procedure was completely wasted. Those x-rays are mine. I should have access to them and the clinic has refused to respond.  I have never had a worst experience in my life at any medical office. I would absolutely avoid having any surgeries or any appointments at this dental practice.

I have been patient at this clinic since 2021 but visited this place only twice - first time for general assessment, second time for dental hygiene.

I have purchased additional dental hygiene in my healthcare insurance and have been paying substantial amount yearly just to get this procedure done (over 100 eur per year just to have hygiene for “free”). Finally got it done in 2021, in my opinion procedure was not very pleasant, hygienist was pretty harsh and it took less than 30min (in my country it takes at least 1hour), my mouth didn’t feel clean at all but I’m not a professional so will not judge this (after getting it assessed by Lithuanian dentist she confirmed job was done well, so it’s just my own experience).

Couple months later I receive invoice for 16 eur! Took a while to find out why I was charged extra - insurance provider was surprised too. After calling dental clinic I was told that dentist took 28 min and my insurance covers 25 min.

Of course it’s a small amount but I find this unfair and something you can inform patients upon arrival - next time I could me less nice to a dentist so she can get her work done on time.

Needless to say I got rid of supplementary insurance and never came back to them. Maybe I will as I still need to get my teeth cleaned but encourage everyone to be sharp with their billing, ask what you are getting what is standard rates and don’t be too nice for staff otherwise they will charge extra.

Very long wait times for appointments (up to 2 months) and frequent delays (of 20–40 minutes with no apology) and last minute cancellations. Each visit, you’re assigned a different dentist, which makes continuity of care impossible. Overall, disappointing service — I’ve decided to switch to another practice.

They have turned the heating down in guest rooms to save money. Around 8 p.m. we called reception to ask if they could increase the temperature, and they refused, saying it was locked centrally for the entire building.

The next morning I asked for a portable heater, and the woman at reception told me they didn’t have any. Later, after calling again and speaking with the manager, it turned out they do have heaters — she simply hadn’t checked. How can a staff member working in a hotel not even ask other colleagues when a guest says they are freezing?

That night I woke up with a severe headache and a head cold from the cold temperature. When the manager arrived the next morning, I told her it was unacceptable and that the heating needed to be turned up — the weather had clearly changed to winter temperatures. She came to the room at 10 a.m. wearing a coat and scarf to check and declared it was “not cold.” Told her to try it out that night without a coat and scarf and she was just arrogant and gas lighting me.

When I asked for a written apology and a refund for the freezing night (and one extra night as compensation), she refused and would not even confirm the refund in writing. I explained calmly that since I had received no refund and check-out was officially at noon, I would remain in the lobby until the matter was resolved. Instead of addressing the issue, they called the police.

Two police officers arrived and, while I was sitting quietly explaining that I was still a paying guest, they used unnecessary physical force to remove me — including kicking me in my ankle - then pushing me out despite my telling them I had an existing foot injury. The incident was deeply distressing and humiliating, and I have filed an official complaint about the police assault.

Be carefull, they Kick you out even earlier. The information for the check out is missleading in Booking it says is at 10 am, the staff kicked me at 8 am and the written rules on the wall says 9 am.

Both my towells were dirty and with smell of humid, like some one else used it, and the land lord instead of seein if the staff or provider did it wrong he get mad at me! See the pictures. Do not stay there!

I leave a bad review and

Very small rooms, toilet and shower not in an extra room, there’s just a glasswall - the „door“ to the toilet cannot be closed entirely, and it’s 1 Meter from the bed.

Fitnessroom: 28 degrees, as its between Swimmingpool and Sauna, very old Equipment.
Sauna nice, but no seperate changing room for men and women.

Entirely old Equipment, hair dryer gave up after 1 Minute.

Restaurant was very good, breakfast too.
Still not a reason to come back.

If I could give it zero stars, I would which is ironic because the name of the hotel literally means "stars”. I stayed at this hotel just outside of Bern during a heatwave, and unfortunately, the experience was extremely disappointing. Nowhere during the booking process did it clearly state that the rooms do not have air conditioning. For $250 a night, this lack of transparency is unacceptable.
The room was unbearably hot, and the only solution offered was two small fans that barely worked—they would randomly stop and start again, which made it impossible to get a good night's sleep. We booked a room for one night to rest after a road trip and we ended up being more exhausted in the morning than when we arrived.
For a hotel charging premium prices, this level of discomfort is simply not okay. I wouldn’t recommend staying here if you’re expecting even a basic level of comfort or a restful night—especially in the summer.

leads.business_name: Il Momento Hotel & Apartments Bern Expo 4 Sterne Hotel
leads.worst_review_text:
It was a hot season, and there was no air conditioning, no fans.
Else, I would have given it 5-stars!

I would NOT recommend this hotel for travelers. First we checked-in, bed sheets were clean but floor was not much clean enough. There is no safe box in the rooms, first time I have ever seen a hotel without safe box? There is also no minibar in the room to let you know guys. Be aware and come with these infos. There is also no wardrobe in the room? It is more like a only sleep and leave hotel. During our stay one of the machines in the breakfast area at breakfast time was broken and constantly leaking , as soon as we see we wanted to inform reception, and receptionist told us to say this problem who serves there. I mean what? You are the one who must be helping not me?
Except breakfast servers, they were nice and trying their best!

leads.business_name: Hotel City am Bahnhof Fassbind Hotels
leads.worst_review_text:
My mom and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July, and we had an awful experience with one of the reception staff, a brown-skinned woman who appeared very friendly but was deeply unprofessional. When we arrived, I asked for the price, hoping for a better deal than online. She offered what seemed like a great price, but only for one double room, despite me clearly requesting two single rooms. I double-checked after feeling that the price was too good to be true(she already made me made the payment), and she played innocent, claiming I had asked for one room. Exhausted after a long journey, I had no choice but to pay for an extra double room, which made the total much higher than the online rate.

When we complained about the inflated prices, she changed the price on the computer right in front of us, treating us like we were stupid and wouldn’t notice. Despite her polite appearance, I could sense deep hostility in her attitude.

She then promised us “good rooms,” but one had zero privacy, with a window facing directly onto a neighbour’s balcony, which was extremely close. The room she labeled as “good” was far from it.

On the third day, the same staff member accused me of not paying the previous day’s city tax, even though I had already paid. She raised her voice, embarrassing me in front of other guests. I had to show my bank transaction to prove it, and even then, she offered no apology, just gave me a fake smile:"alright, you can go now."

As a PhD student in Canada, I have no trouble communicating in English, so this was definitely not a language issue. I can’t help but wonder if we were treated this way because we are Asian. This experience left us feeling extremely unwelcome, and I have no desire to return to this hotel because of this staff.

If flavor had feelings, it definitely didn’t live here.

Before I post this, I want to say something that matters to me:
When a customer shares their experience, it shouldn’t be treated as an attack. A review is feedback, not a fight. It’s how restaurants learn what’s working and what isn’t. I noticed some responses from the restaurant to other reviews here felt more defensive than curious, especially when multiple people mention similar issues (like bland food).

I’m leaving it because people deserve to know what they’re paying for, just as restaurants deserve honest feedback that helps them improve. I also wished you would have asked for my feedback when my plate was taken half full from the table…

For the price you pay at Trattoria Antichi Sapori, this was the most unsatisfactory value meal I’ve ever experienced. $60 for a white truffle pasta that was so bland, I could hardly ate the half of it.

I ordered two dishes with truffle (an appetizer and a white truffle pasta). Both were so bland I kept checking whether I had suddenly lost my taste buds. No salt, no pepper, no depth, no flavor, even the truffle couldn’t rescue it. That’s some talent there by itself. lol

Several of us at the table felt the food was very bland, and we even had to add salt and pepper just to bring out some flavor.

The only bright spot was our server, I believed he was the owner at the same time. He was very kind and friendly, but there were only two people working the floor, so we barely saw him. After we finished eating, my half untouched meal sat there for around 1.5 hours in front of me until only then it was grabbed in hurry.

The dessert (dark chocolate) was actually the best thing we ordered.

We saw this restaurant featured in a newspaper, and honestly, it created expectations the food did not meet at all. Maybe they had a better day when the journalist visited, I just know our experience was nowhere near what was promised.

I also noticed that several other reviews mention the same thing about the food being bland. When multiple guests share similar feedback, it usually means there’s something worth improving. I truly hope the kitchen takes that to heart, because the atmosphere and our lovely host deserves food that matches their energy.

And on a positive note, if one day you feel you’ve worked on these flavors and would like to host us to share an honest feedback, I’d be happy to return with an open mind. A great experience deserves to be shared just as much as a disappointing one.

I’ve been wanting to dine here for quite some time and had even messaged them previously to enquire, but unfortunately never received a reply. A friend chose this place for our lunch meet-up yesterday, so I finally had the chance to try it.

The setting was lovely — calm, quiet, and not too crowded, which made for a pleasant atmosphere. However, the lunch experience itself was a bit underwhelming. They offered only three set menus, with no option to order à la carte, and the content felt rather meagre for the price. It wasn’t quite what I had expected.

That said, I imagine the restaurant might shine more during dinner service, though the prices seem a little high for my comfort.

leads.business_name: Blumen für die Seele – Am Pradler Friedhof

leads.worst_review_text: Bouquet of roses for Valentine's Day at €80. I've given many roses as gifts, but never paid this much. After four days, the roses were no longer worth looking at... never again.

leads.business_name: Blumen Tauber - Anna TAU Meisterfloristik Igls

leads.worst_review_text:
I bought a bouquet of flowers for €19, which unfortunately turned out to be very small – I would have expected much more for that price. Even more disappointing, however, was that the flowers were already wilted the next day.

When I politely asked the store today why this might have happened, an employee rudely told me that it was my fault because I hadn't cut the flowers. Perhaps I should have known that fresh flowers should be cut – but I expect a specialty store to actively advise customers of this rather than blaming them after the fact.

A younger employee in the store was very understanding and even offered to give me new flowers. But her supposed boss immediately blocked my offer – a shame, because she certainly could have handled the situation in a more customer-friendly manner.

Overall, I'm disappointed by the lack of friendliness and the poor service. Next time, I'd rather take the slightly longer route and go to Blumen Hajny on Museumstraße, where customers are still valued.

leads.address: Blumen und Lifestyle Im Arkadenhof, Maria-Theresien-Straße 34, 6020 Innsbruck, Austria

leads.worst_review_text: I arrive at the store today at 6:30 p.m. I ask if they have any red roses. The salesperson says, "What do you need for one? Long, short, medium?" I can't really imagine the difference and react hesitantly. The salesperson huffs, "Pff," and, obviously annoyed, wants to get some roses. To that, I reply, "No, thanks, bye." Friendliness is zero, and I won't be coming back, of course.

It's sad how older people are treated here... I've never experienced anything like it. In so many branches, employees still accept the card for people who don't have the app... Even if it's no longer legally valid, it's the tone that matters, dear employees... I simply won't be shopping here anymore and won't be recommending this branch to anyone.

I ordered a bouquet, and upon picking it up, I unfortunately discovered that it wasn't as described. Furthermore, the bouquet contained wilted flowers, and the paper sleeve had been carelessly cut and wrapped around, leaving the cut edges looking very unsightly.
When I pointed this out, I was unfortunately fobbed off.

leads.business_name: Flow by Christian Altendorfer - Meisterfloristik - Workshops - Blumen - Pflanzen - Events - Blumenbinderei - Kurse

leads.worst_review_text: Very disappointed in the outcome

Bad service and incompetent consulting. I'll avoid this pharmacy and will turn in future to pharmacists that are less centrally situated and can give me all their attention and patience, as I expect it from service in healthcare

leads.address: INFRA CENTER, Wegscheider Str. 3, 4020 Linz, Austria
leads.worst_review_text:
I am very disappointed. I was given medications whose expiration dates were, in some cases, already within the same month. This is very annoying and completely unsatisfactory for me as a customer.

I have also heard from other customers that they have had similar negative experiences. In my opinion, something like this should not happen in a pharmacy in Austria, as it concerns people's health.

I sincerely hope that improvements will be made urgently.
Not suitable for strollers or wheelchairs.

You better not forget anything cause they don’t return it, they’re thiefs. They say they have lockers to keep your things if you arrive early but they’re a few and all block. The matress and pillows are so hard you woke up with your back and neck hurt, you can hear all of the noise of the other bedrooms and even from the street. If you got big luggage the last floor doesn’t count with stairs. The bathroom is not a bathroom and they charge extra if you wanna get your room clean.

leads.business_name: HUNGRY DUCK | CHICKEN WINGS - ALL YOU CAN EAT EVERY DAY

leads.worst_review_text: Next time i will pay a bit more and go to a different hotel or look into it a bit more before booking. I recently stayed at this hotel, and unfortunately, my experience did not meet my expectations. The staff seemed quite indifferent,  additionally, there were many stairs at the entrance, making access quite challenging. The cleanliness in the rooms and surroundings was below par, and the area where the hotel is located did not feel safe.

leads.business_name: Holiday Inn - the niu, Yen Hamburg City, an IHG Hotel
leads.worst_review_text: The location is close to the subway for more than ten minutes, and there are not many good restaurants nearby. You need to walk for twenty minutes to get to a good restaurant. The facilities and beds in the room are good, but there is no mineral water provided, not even a bottle. Moreover, there is no mini fridge or cup for drinking water in the room, and there is even no coffee machine provided. I really feel terrible. It's just a feeling of wanting guests to stay overnight and leave quickly. Guests don't even have time to have a cup of coffee or drinking water in their room. This is not a real holiday inn hotel. When my partner and I booked this hotel, we realized we made a mistake. There were two hotels with the same name. I don't recommend everyone to stay here, otherwise you will regret it very much. If you want to stay at Holiday Inn, please don't read it wrong.

leads.business_name: Crowne Plaza Hamburg - City Alster by IHG

leads.worst_review_text:
Unprofessional organization: BIG TIME LOSS!

I have come three times for the very same issue and everytime they tell me to schedule a next appointment because they don’t have time todo it in the scheduled time!
This is only a place to do a cleaning of the teeth once a year

leads.business_name: Courtyard by Marriott Munich City Center
leads.worst_review_text:
Been there for a weekend and had a very bad experience. Two hours after the checkout, my husband received an invoice charging us 50 euro for "equipment rental". When we question then about it, they alleged to be due to a portable hair dryer missing. However the only hair dryer we saw in the room was in the toilet and attached to the wall. Luckily we were still in the city and walked back to the hotel to solve this in person (our luggage were also storaged at the hotel). Talking with the lady in the front office, she tried to convince us, with a smirking on her face, that there were no hair dryer attached in the restroom. This cannot be true as we were there, we saw that. We asked if they wanted to check out our luggage and bags and she said this were not necessary, although she talked in german in front of us (assuming that we don't understand German because we communicate all the time in English) to another colleague that "those are the guests who took the hairdryer" and that would call the manager, said manager that never talked with us or even apologized for the terrible experience. In the end, she agreed to refund but the money is still on hold.

Other considerations:
I have to say that the staff were nice most of the time. However we found problem when needed anything from them, e.g. we asked for slippers thrice and did not get it. Only on the 4th time, when we went directly to the reception and waited there for that.

We had breakfast only once because we thought the fridge with the stick saying "vegan" were filled with vegan food and it was not, was full of "normal cheese" misleading us into taking some of it but being vegan for so long now we asked the staff the only replied "is normal cheese so we keep it cold". So, if you are vegan or lactose intolerant, be careful and double check the products in there. They do have vegan options but it is not "wide range of vegan options" as they stated in their webpage. You can find fruits, breads, potato chips, jams, and a type of sausage spread. Also plant based milk and alpro dessert.

The bed was uncomfortable. It felt like a bunch of stacked cartoons.

Rooms seemed clean at first sight but there were what I suppose to be pubic hair around the bath.

Location was very nice. Close to the central station and walking distance to the old town.

leads.business_name: Hampton by Hilton Munich City North
leads.worst_review_text:
A very disappointing stay. The front desk staff was unfriendly and refused to change room without offering any solution. The room was small and uncomfortable — not worth the price at all. Breakfast was basic and limited.
Housekeeping didn’t clean the room after the first night — they only started cleaning from the second night, and even then very slowly. The air conditioning could not be set above 23°C; the staff said it was “the rule.” When I asked to see the rule, they simply ignored me.
There’s hardly any free parking at the hotel, which is very inconvenient.
There are many better options in this area with friendlier staff, better breakfast, and more reasonable prices.

Terrible hotel, the rooms are tiny and so are the bathrooms. We are not sure which rooms they have taken photos of and used to advertise but it was not what we got. The location is not great and does not feel very safe. Staff told us it would be okay if we walk a few minutes from the hotel where things become nicer, which was concerning. There are much better hotels in much nicer locations in Munich.

The hotel is well placed, and in walking distance to buss connections and metro. The expectasions didnt meet up with What we came too, in the pictures the room looked quite Nice but that wasnt really the case when we checked in. About the service the people working there was quite Nice aswell but when we arrived we got a key to a room where someone allready was staying and i have to say that if Thats the case i would be worried About My bags and other things innside the room.

leads.business_name: Holiday Inn Express Berlin City Centre by IHG
Mondrian Suites Hotel Berlin Checkpoint Charlie
leads.worst_review_text:
The hotel looks quite modern in photos, but the reality didn’t exactly match the expectations. The hallways are very dim and feel a bit gloomy — almost like they’re trying to save on electricity. Not the most welcoming vibe when you’re coming back late.

I was also pretty shocked to be charged 6 euros for two basic teabags. Not a kettle set, not a pot — literally just two teabags. It felt like they’re trying to squeeze every cent they can out of guests, which leaves a bad impression.

The location is convenient for getting around, but the surroundings aren’t the nicest. Not the best street views, and there were constant fireworks going off throughout the night, which didn’t help with getting any decent sleep.

Overall, the rooms are okay, but the atmosphere and extra charges really let the place down. Wouldn’t rush to stay here again.

leads.business_name: Park Inn by Radisson Berlin Alexanderplatz

leads.worst_review_text:
Breakfast terrible !!! I don’t know how the guests said that is good !

Full of insects everywhere, the iogurte was getting warm , salad was looking from 3 days ago , was hard to speak in English with the breakfast service staff…
Please don’t take it there is no higiene on it ! There is a lot of breakfast coffee around or you can ask in Uber eats…

leads.address: 5191 W Charleston Blvd Suite 175, Las Vegas, NV 89146, USA
2595 S Maryland Pkwy UNIT 106, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
leads.worst_review_text: I have used Vegas Vision for the last 6 years and have always had good service when it came to my eye glasses but on December the 1st that changed. I went in to see Dr Chan but this time it wasn't him it was what I could only assume was a student filling in for him. My visit wasn't for glasses but for a infected eye that has a inner stye. The So called Optometrist that was there sat me down spent almost the entire time with his attention drawn to the computer didnt listen to my story that lead up to the event that caused my stye and acted the whole time like I was taking up his time. I explained in detail and non of it was of any interest to him just handed me a referral and said my eye had a stroke and no medication was needed no antibiotics nothing  just go home and wait for your appointment on the 18th and see what they say. I should have known something was wrong because when I got there for my 1115 am appointment there were 4 other patients in front of me and he saw all of them in in under 30 minutes as they were getting exams. This review isn't on Dr Chan but this individual that was in charge that day. Even the online Doctors said he should have prescribed me some kind of antibiotics for the infection and pain and advised me for home remedies like warm compress to help until my appointment but he did not just said nothing needed. I could have done better just going to the ER. I am very disappointed that I went that day just to see a student who couldn't help me no wonder he didn't prescribed me anything he may not have the requirements to do so. Thank you.

Review:
This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The room felt like a bare prison cell – no warmth, no comfort, no basic amenities. No hair dryer, no fridge, and the sink was awkwardly in the bedroom instead of the bathroom. The place felt depressing and cheap despite the high price. Absolutely no attention to guest comfort. If you value your money, your sleep, or your mood, avoid this place completely.

leads.business_name: Naumann Optik Inh. Anika Rosen-Schilfarth e.K.

leads.worst_review_text:
I've been a regular customer at this store for years, and lately I've simply become dissatisfied.
My glasses are fitted incorrectly upon pickup, and the new staff is incredibly unfriendly and no longer customer-focused at all.
To get an eye test, you're required to choose a frame beforehand, even though it's not even clear whether your prescription has changed.
The fact that some customers get an eye test and then go elsewhere with their prescriptions is certainly the reason they tie the eye test to a pair of glasses.
However, I don't understand why, as an existing customer who has bought almost 10 pairs of glasses there, I can't have my prescription checked and adjusted accordingly.
Add to that the rude tone of the employee—no thanks!!!
Both I and my family will be buying our glasses from a more customer-focused optician in the future.
It's a shame, because in the past, friendliness and competence were very important there.

Absolutely trash. Don't ever get this place.
Room was very small and all the beddings that they provided smelt bad, the room itself smelt bad as if no one cleaned the room for a month. They don't have a luggage locker, and the small locker they have was 4 euro for 24hrs with free re-open in the meantime, but it doesn't work. I paid 4 euro and started using the locker from 11pm, and the next day 10:30am when I tried to open it, locker just locked the key and never returned it to me.
I asked the front desk about this and they were saying they can't give me a refund or anything. And what's up with that attitude? Is simply asking for a refund for it was such an inconvinience?
Oh and in the room there's no plug on the visible space. In 6p room. There's one right next to the bathroom and that's all visible one. I found one plug was behind the bed which was impossible to use as it was too close to the bed frame, yes I can move the bunkbed and use it but good luck with moving the bed around when other person is sleeping on the bed as well. The bunk bed has an adapter which doesn't work. Horrible interior design. Horrible experience. Never, ever stay in this hostel.

The location is excellent, right in the heart of Graz, which made getting around very convenient. However, the room was quite deteriorated and not very clean. It definitely needs renovation and better upkeep. Disappointing overall, especially considering the NH brand standards.

Hotel experience completly ruined by not having any hot water for a bath!!
Room was fine and clean beakfast was solid nothing special.
Staff said there is some issues with heating but when i look at other reviews from a week ago i see people also complained so no exuses they should have fixed it.

Stayed here as part of a business trip for 4 days and the air conditioning did not work. The air conditioner blew out hot air only even after setting it right. Had to keep my window open for better ventilation. The hotel offered a table fan which was also limited in number and not everyone could get it. I had colleagues staying on lower floors and they couldnt keep their windows open fearing for their safety. I have never faced this situation across the world anywhere even after paying so much. I have read reviews where guests have complained about air conditioning 7 months ago but still the problem hasn’t been resolved. The hotel is old fashioned and needs renovation. The breakfast was excellent and checkin/checkout was smooth.

If I could I would give 0 to them! Heating doesn't work. We wanted to call reception, but the phone also haven't work so I had to go to them. Twice. The receptionist was super rude, no polite at all and his solution was to bring the heater inside the room if they find it, and backup solution was to give us extra blankets. Outside temperature -4. After a long waiting time they finaly gave us heater with no excuse. When we try to speak with him he left us in the midlle of the sentence, said "bye, bye" and left. No maners at all. Worst and the rudest receptioner I ever met. Not the mention small rooms, small bathroom... If we were a little bit bigger we couldn't fit and move in room. Desaster! Leaving a picture of the "perfect", "genious" solution.

Our stay at Motel One Graz from December 13th to 15th, 2025 was a complete failure.
Check-in collapsed entirely due to a computer system outage. Guests waited for hours with no clear information, no access to restrooms (room cards were required), and no basic hospitality such as water or coffee. By early evening, the lobby looked like an emergency shelter, with families preparing to sleep on sofas.
The following morning, breakfast was overcrowded and poorly planned. Only a few proper tables and seating were provided, many guests had to use those mini lobby tables and sofas. Families, and elderly guests could not eat comfortably. I personally had to eat sitting on the floor. At this price level, this is unacceptable.
To make matters worse, we also did not receive the room type we paid for. One of our children is sixteen years old and counts as an adult, yet one of the booked double rooms had only a single bed. This resulted in three adults and one seven-year-old child sharing only three sleeping places.
Our request to have the rooms next to each other, or at least on the same floor, was rejected abruptly and without courtesy.

Staff appeared overwhelmed and powerless. No apologies were offered at check-in, during the stay, or at check-out.
This hotel clearly sells more rooms than its facilities and staff can handle. When occupancy is high, service collapses. That is a management issue, not bad luck.
I would not stay here again and cannot recommend this hotel.

We had booked two rooms on 2nd of January 2026 but one of them had a really bad smell. We reported it at reception, the staff member came to check and agreed there was a foul odour, but they couldn’t give us another room — only an air purifier that had to run for 30 minutes starting at 21:30, right when our kids needed to sleep. Very disappointing experience.

One always has to start with something positive: the location is great. And unfortunately that's where it ends. We booked the suite which definitely doesn't deserve such a name. Having stayed in many hotels around the world. From one to five stars this room deserved 2 stars and not more. Thanks to a headphone that fell underneath our sofa I realized how dirty this room was. The sofa bed had a huge amount of dust. Underneath the bed was a dead wasp from the summer days. The curtains were partially falling down from the ceiling and very dirty again. The room separating the living and bedroom was not working. The bedroom was very bright as it is a very flimsy and thin curtain. The toilet flush was half broken and the list goes on. Our 6yo son didn't sleep well as the room was very bright and kids never lie.

Reply from the manager?

- 30 Euro discount
- Nobody else has complained about the curtain before. Does this mean that my complaint is not correct?

I wish this hotel all the best as this is not how you survive in today's market. Never again.

Total disgrace !
One elevator didn’t work. The wall needed to be painted . The floor of my room 308 looks like a roller skating rink full of luggage tracks. The room cleaning is substandard. Worst and the worst of the worse is the WiFi didn’t work well. It was unstable going from no internet to 1 bar to 2 bars in my antenna to no internet to 1 bar to no internet. The bathroom door is transparent .
The receptionists were all very nice. The hotel manager and the company that manages this hotel need to stay there themselves to experience what I experienced.
My advice. Don’t waste money on this hotel. Go somewhere. else.

Update. I am now in Plitvice Lakes National Park. I am staying in guest house. The WiFi in the middle of nowhere is much better than the this place which is in the capital of Styria .

Very bad experience for the following reasons: (1) Dirty rooms with hair all over the place. Stayed for two days and no cleaning came in the meantime to clean and replace towels. (2) They claim on booking they have fitness center but then when you ask for it they referr you to McFit across the streat for 8 eur. (3) Left without soap in the bathroom and had to pick it up myself at the reception. (4) Finally, went for breakfast but it was so crowded I could not find the table, and once I found it no one came to clean it for half an hour. Very poor menu for breakfast.

leads.address: Mönchsberg Park 26, Mönchsberg Park 26, 5020 Salzburg, Austria

leads.worst_review_text: Sorry but if you charge that amount of money for that little quantity of food (nice food, don't get me wrong but tiny portions) then at least your service should be impeccable. Maybe, I want to think, tonight you had an issue and you had less people working. Anyway your waiters were waaay too slow, unaware, non informative and to be honest, absolutely junior. I assume you can get away with it if you have new tourists each night, but I would go first to any honest average traditional austrian restaurant before coming back to you. I hope this review is useful so you can improve the issues because the main idea is good.

We went for Christmas dinner, and it was clear that they were not prepared for the volume of people they had there. We sent the following email to management the same evening after our experience and received no reply:

We had a 5:30pm reservation this evening. We were the second table seated in our room. An amuse bouche came at 6:18, followed by the first course at 7:42pm. Waiting more than two hours for our actual meal to start is unacceptable, particularly since other tables received their first courses before us. We had told the waitstaff shortly after sitting that we needed to leave at 8:15 to make our 9pm train. I believe she did her best but there must have been an issue with the kitchen. The table next to us left in frustration. We kept hoping the meal would arrive. Finally at 8:05, we told our waitress that we really must leave, so the kitchen packed up the remaining food. I have attached pictures of what it looked like. Somehow it included 2 servings of courses we had already eaten and 3 main dishes with meat. No vegetarian meal.

In addition, although we requested gluten free and the server confirmed we had ordered gluten free, we never received it. Our daughter was served bread and ravioli, the same as the rest of us. However, it was clear the waitstaff was overwhelmed, and so we just did the best we could with what we received. It was supposed to be an enjoyable Christmas meal, but instead we felt hungry and stressed out as we ran to meet our train.

I discussed the situation briefly with the manager and received a 200 euro discount before we left, but I would have continued the discussion if I had the time. The meal and drinks were certainly not worth the nearly 600 euro we ended up paying.

—-
I have attached pictures of all the food we received except for the amuse bouche. The food that was packaged was inedible, especially the dessert. They wrapped up napkins with the cake and it all became one big mushy mess.

Update: In response to the restaurant’s message… we selected the 4 course meal, and we were at the restaurant for 2 hours and 45 minutes. In that time, we only received 2 out of 4 courses. No one offered our daughter gluten free options for the bread or ravioli. They were simply placed in front of her by frazzled waitstaff.

I do understand that packaging our food was an extra support for our predicament. However it should not have been necessary to do that in the first place. Our 4 course meal began nearly 2 hours and 15 minutes after we sat down, which is simply crazy.
